parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
On this day, we crown you king. King Dormato the first of his name. Ruler - \|\|\^
- of Luthania and father of wisdom. Long may he reign. \|\|\^

Cedric, I have just received word from a reliable source in Rossmaur, a - \|\|\^
- closely allied kingdom of ours. Apparently, someone is killing of their - \|\|\^
- people. They were quick to pass the blame to us but I had to nip that - \|\|\^
- accusation in the bud. So, will you go out the problem as a token of peace? - \|\|\^
- It's only north of here, I’m sending you as I don’t know who to trust here yet. \|\|\^
I guess it wouldn't hurt. Besides the more allies the better. \|\|\^
Yes, and I guess you do owe Luthania a favour after killing our king. \|\|\^
There’s no need to be like that. I didn’t realise you would have preferred - \|\|\^
- to have been in a cell for the remainder of your life. \|\|\^
Just go! And try not to kill their queen. \|\|\^
You obtained Luthania's Entry in the Journal.
Would you like to save game?
\n<Prince Dormato> It's weird to think that this morning I was
a prince and now I am the king.

Lords and ladies, my friends, my closest companions, on this day we gather - \|\|\^
- to celebrate the glorious news that my wife Queen Idelle is expecting - \|\|\^
- our first child. The heir to the Luthanian throne. \|\|\^
People of the Kingdom of Luthania let us pray that the child will be - \|\|\^
- strong and wise like our great King Dormato. Father Creye please do - \|\|\^
Yes, my lord. Let the gods look over the child and bring them up in the - \|\|\^
- right way. So that they one day will watch over the glorius Kingdom - \|\|\^
- of Luthania with wisdom and strength and take us into an everlasting - \|\|\^
- era of increased prosperity and growth. Let the god Unito bring them peace - \|\|\^
- and the goddess Nesskind help them show gentleness towards our people. - \|\|\^
- Let their ancestors up in Nirvan guide them. May the gods bless them. \|\|\^
\n<King Dormato> I guess my child will have you for an

Cedric, there are serious problems that are taking place in the south. - \|\|\^
- I recieved word that the solution that you and your brother came up with - \|\|\^
- failed. Roswell has taken control and he is making his way up north. - \|\|\^
- You need to go to the Luthania’s southern border and help protect it. \|\|\^
I can't believe Roswell has turned, I really thought he was an appropriate - \|\|\^
- choice. I thought he would see past the power. \|\|\^
\n<King Dormato> Things are getting worse as we speak.
\n<King Dormato> Cedric! You finally showed up, I've been
waiting for your return. I heard about what’s
happening in Innes. I received word from your
brother that Innes, Rouge and Grispon were
\n<King Dormato> invaded. He warned me that Roswell is
sending his armies north. Your brother let
me know he's on his way to help defend
Luthania and the neighbouring kingdoms. I
\n<King Dormato> myself have taken certain measures to help
protect Luthania by forming an alliance
with Rossmaur and Spaul, enlisting their
help in the battles to come. Their armies
\n<King Dormato> are on their way here and the western Spaul
border. With that going on we need to
secure the safety of the people in this
\n<Cedric> And how are we going to protect the people
\n<King Dormato> Well for a start I will need you to go to
\n<King Dormato> Thank you. That is all.
\n<King Dormato> Thank you for getting the people to safety.
I just received word that Roswell’s men are
at the border. Go and help defend it.

I don't know how long we will be able to keep the borders under control. We're - \|\|\^
- going to have to come up with a new strategy because so far, we are - \|\|\^
Richard! You’re here and safe. I was worried that you had been caught. \|\|\^
I’m safe Cedric. In response to what you were saying your Grace, what we could - \|\|\^
- do is try to take him out from within? \|\|\^
One of us would sneak into Rinsar, as that's his stronghold and then take - \|\|\^
- him out. Without a leader, his dominion would fall apart. \|\|\^
I don’t know why I asked. How are we going to achieve this? \|\|\^
Well, you can’t travel through the southern border, Roswell’s men are - \|\|\^
- stationed in Rouge, Innes and Grispon. \|\|\^
Well, Rinsar is the southernmost kingdom, so Cedric will need to go south - \|\|\^
Well, you can travel by ship to Rinsar from the northern port town Bandershatch. - \|\|\^
- I’ll arrange for a ship to take you down to Rinsar. You will have to make your - \|\|\^
- way to Rinsar when it docks. \|\|\^
Very well, I will head that way then. \|\|\^
Would you like to save game?
\n<Royal Adviser> I have seen many things come and go
hopefully he will be a good ruler.
\n<Royal Adviser> My Lord, an heir to the throne will
\n<Queen Rosa> My son is finally King. This is one of my
\n<Queen Rosa> Ah Lord Cedric, once again I want to say
thank you for what you did before. You have
been an immense help. I have only positive
\n<Idelle> I guess this is my home now.
\n<Queen Idelle> Cedric I’m so excited to see you I'm
ecstatic to see you came. I can't believe
that I'm going to have an actual child, an
heir at it as well. Although I hope they
\n<Queen Idelle> aren’t expecting me to clean this child
\n<Cedric> Idelle I have to say I'm proud of you
I'm going to be an Uncle.
\n<Queen Idelle> Well be sure to check out the celebrations
Luthania is a safe haven from the rest of the realm you
can always come here to buy, sell, play and refresh.
\n<Queen Idelle> I'm having a baby. I'm having a baby!
\n<Priest> The gods will look over this child.
They will be a person of distinction.
\n<Richard> Its good to see you brother.

Cedric. I see you are back. Such a delight. \|\|\^
Why do you look so glum? You are the king? The great King Dormato. \|\|\^
Yes go on, mock me. You’re upset that I’m not warm towards you. Well forgive - \|\|\^
- me, it’s hard to get over the fact that you killed my father. \|\|\^
Yes, I know how it must feel for you. But I did what was necessary. \|\|\^
Necessary? Just go, I’m sure you’re sister would prefer your company. \|\|\^

Don’t play dumb with me! What was that? You’re trying to have me removed - \|\|\^
- from the castle? Or maybe killed? \|\|\^
Your guards stopping me; telling me they have orders to not let me into - \|\|\^
I don’t know what you are on about. I gave no such orders. \|\|\^
Of course, you didn’t. You hate me for killing your father. The guards even - \|\|\^
They did? What guards? Bring them to me. \|\|\^
Dead?! Is your first instinct just to kill?! Are you a savage?! \|\|\^
No. I only kill those that try to kill me. \|\|\^
Is that a threat? Should I take that as a threat? \|\|\^
Take it however you want. You’re just a bitter little man. Upset, because I - \|\|\^
- killed your father to save you and Idelle. If I hadn’t been there you would - \|\|\^
- both be dead right now. You should be on your knees thanking me! \|\|\^
Thank you? Don’t turn your back on me! Cedric! Don’t walk away from me! \|\|\^

No, you’re not. I heard what happened with Cedric. Did you really try to - \|\|\^
- have my brother killed? After all, he has done for us? \|\|\^
Then explain why guards attacked him? \|\|\^
I don’t know. Although he is pushing me towards that option with his remarks. \|\|\^
He is my brother and he won’t be harmed. You may not have given - \|\|\^
- the orders to attack Cedric. But the guards clearly acted in your interest. - \|\|\^
- Probably due to the way you have treated him since he rescued you. - \|\|\^
- You need to fix things with him. \|\|\^
I don’t know if I can do that. \|\|\^
If you want to take your time with Cedric, fine. But you need to start taking - \|\|\^
- your place as king seriously, ruling and visiting the towns. - \|\|\^
I know what I must do. \|\|\^
You do? Then why are we having this conversation? \|\|\^
Everywhere I go I am reminded of him. Everyone talks about the great king he - \|\|\^
- was before he went mad. How am I supposed to live up to that? I feel lost. \|\|\^
You won’t be able to if you don’t get up and rule. You’re not the only one who - \|\|\^
- has lost their parents. I lost both my mother and father however I - \|\|\^
- realised that I have a duty I must carry out even if I am hurting inside. You - \|\|\^
- need to realise that too. Fix things before it’s too late. \|\|\^

No… it’s not an issue. I don’t know if I’m prepared, all I know is that I am - \|\|\^
- king so I must be prepared. I must act as a beacon of hope for my entire - \|\|\^
- kingdom even if I have lost hope. Who do I put my hope in? Should I - \|\|\^
- die it will be the end of my house. What makes it worse is I’d be forgotten. - \|\|\^
- It’s the victor who writes history. \|\|\^
You won’t be forgotten and we will win. \|\|\^
How can you be so sure? I haven’t done anything, nothing to be remembered by. - \|\|\^
- Maybe the ‘The King Who Did Nothing’. I wasted my time sulking, trying to - \|\|\^
- live in the past. I should’ve been tending to the needs of my people, - \|\|\^
- rebuilding Luthania after all the pain it has suffered. I loved my father and - \|\|\^
- always will but he’s dead and I need to be helping those who are living as their - \|\|\^
- King. If I live through this I will take my duty seriously. \|\|\^
That’s a good way to look at it. \|\|\^
Good? You killed my father. I won’t forget that. \|\|\^
Maybe you should see how the others are doing. \|\|\^
